alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:47PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE FRIDAY FOR SOUTHERN PANHANDLE... A system could bring accumulating snow to the Southern Panhandle and parts of the outer coastal areas, from Port Alexander south, on Friday. Some scenarios offer the possibility of 3-5 inches of snowfall accumulation during this time. However, an anticipated southerly wind push could bring in warmer air and result in a quick transition or mix with rain. This would keep snowfall totals lower, particularly near sea level and areas like Craig and Hydaburg. Another possibility is that outflow winds erode much of the precipitation before it reaches populated areas, resulting in lower totals than anticipated. Should confidence rise in the greater snowfall totals, Winter Weather Advisories may be issued. Please stay tuned to our website, NOAA weather radio, or local media for changes to the forecast.
